definition: to merge with/interlinking/to join with/to interlock
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
lit. short-weaponed soldiery fight one another (idiom); fierce hand-to-hand infantry combat/to fight at close quarters
to join head to tail/bumper-to-bumper (of traffic jam)

sentences.english: It was bumper-to-bumper all the way from school.
sentences.chinese: 從學校過來的路上都是一輛輛首尾相接的車。

sentences.english: They closed with their enemy and started a fierce struggle.
sentences.chinese: 他們與敵人短兵相接，一場激戰開始了。

sentences.english: The single-phase-to-earth fault in the system takes place frequently.
sentences.chinese: 在這類系統中，發生最多的是單相接地故障。

sentences.english: The mandala of between machines were used conveyor.
sentences.chinese: 其中間的機器之間可用輸送機相接。

sentences.english: A car turned over and blocked the road, so all the traffic was held up.
sentences.chinese: 從學校過來的路上都是一輛輛首尾相接的車。

sentences.english: Our soldiers grappled with the enemy at close range .
sentences.chinese: 我們的戰士和敵人短兵相接地搏鬥。

sentences.english: The septum articulates caudally with the anterior nasal spine.
sentences.chinese: 鼻中隔的尾側端與前鼻棘相接。

sentences.english: Green jade blue sky with broad ocean water the sky connect.
sentences.chinese: 碧藍的天空與遼闊的大海水天相接。

sentences.english: A lifting handle is arranged on the toaster, which is connected with the switch C.
sentences.chinese: 多士爐上設置有一提手，該提手與開關C相接。

sentences.english: In modern naval warfare, men seldom fight hand to hand.
sentences.chinese: 在現代海戰中，很少有短兵相接的場面。

sentences.english: Blink of an eye, Tianshui phase appeared together with the landlord Hongxia.
sentences.chinese: 轉眼間，天水相接的地主出現了一道紅霞。

sentences.english: Objective To observe the effect of fabricating tissue-engineering bone using biphasic seeding method.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察雙相接種法構建組織工程骨的效果。

sentences.english: As for the connecting part with the heart, I covered it with some green grass and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 而在桃心相接的底部，我加入了一些綠草和灌木。

sentences.english: Bereavements and blessings, one following another, make us sad and biessed by turns.
sentences.chinese: 喪親之痛和緈褔祝願，彼此相接，使我們悲喜交加。

sentences.english: Of furniture decorate should size look line, on any account is conterminous , strewn at random have send.
sentences.chinese: 傢俱的佈置應該大小相襯，高低相接，錯落有致。

sentences.english: The single line-to-ground (SLG) faults in low ground current system may have many features.
sentences.chinese: 小電流接地系統單相接地時有許多特點。

definition: to link/to join/link/connection
to flow together/confluence (of rivers, airflow, roads)/(international) cooperation
to cross over (e.g. traffic)/to intersect/to make friends
to look at one another/to face each other
to link up/to thread together
to connect/to communicate/to relate/(math.) connected
to adjoin
common boundary/common border
to crisscross/to intertwine
horizontal traverse/to cut across/to cross transversally
to link up/to join together/to connect
lit. warp string in weaving/fig. vertical or north-south lines/to pass through/to cross lengthwise/to pierce (esp. north-south or top-to-bottom)
to interact/interrelated
overall length/span
western extremity
northern extremity
